about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:

about.name: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should: | If your vehicle begins to skid, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.

comment.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.
Brake as hard as possible.
Turn off the ignition.

acceptedAnswer.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.

comment.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

comment.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should: | If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

hasPart.name: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:

about.name: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:

hasPart.assesses: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane: | When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.

comment.text: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.

comment.text: If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

acceptedAnswer.text: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

answerExplanation.text: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

comment.text: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane: | Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

hasPart.name: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about:

about.name: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about:

hasPart.assesses: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about: | To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To avoid last-minute moves, you should scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This allows you to see hazards before meeting them.

comment.text: 5 to 10 seconds.
10 to 15 seconds.
15 to 20 seconds.
10 to 15 seconds.

answerExplanation.text: To avoid last-minute moves, you should scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This allows you to see hazards before meeting them.

hasPart.name: U-turns in business districts are:
hasPart.assesses: U-turns in business districts are: | U-turns in business districts are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.

comment.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.

comment.text: Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

comment.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

acceptedAnswer.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

comment.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

answerExplanation.text: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

comment.text: U-turns in business districts are: | In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

hasPart.name: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

about.name: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

hasPart.assesses: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: | Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

suggestedAnswer.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

comment.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

suggestedAnswer.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.

comment.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.

suggestedAnswer.text: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

comment.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

answerExplanation.text: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

comment.text: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: | A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

hasPart.name: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:

about.name: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:

hasPart.assesses: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is: | Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

comment.text: Allowed from both directions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Allowed only from your direction of travel.

comment.text: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
Not allowed from either direction.
Not allowed from either direction.

answerExplanation.text: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

comment.text: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is: | A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.
